{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-13T19:13:17.000Z", "description": "

SRE @MLB has a focus on providing consulting services to any and all engineering teams throughout the organization to help in certain key areas:

  • Incident response
  • Kubernetes operations
  • User experience optimization through SLIs and SLOs
  • High Availability and Disaster recovery planning
  • Debugging running systems and providing tools to assist runtime debugging
  • Observability tooling
  • Optimizations for cost control


As an SRE at MLB you will:

  • Write software in python, Golang, bash, Typescript, Javascript, HCL, and maybe C/C++.
  • Use and administer Grafana
  • Write and maintain plugins for Grafana (both open source and not)
  • Write and maintain tools that help software engineering teams function better
  • Consult with engineering teams in the key areas outlined above
  • Help promote good observability culture throughout MLB
  • Help enhance the next generation of APM tooling
  • Be on-call for SRE managed services
  • Use Google Cloud Platform
  • Use and understand statistics
  • Provide advice around HA and DR initiatives
  • Assist teams in understanding their operational dollar cost and optimizations to reduce same
  • Automate telemetry collection


A good fit for this role will:

  • Have an eagerness to be a self-starter and get things done
  • Have written code in a compiled language that runs in production somewhere
  • Have written code in interpreted languages
  • Have a good understanding of the JVM and Java
  • Have worked with time series data extensively
  • Have worked with o11y tools extensively
  • Have some experience with Terraform
  • Be able to communicate effectively and asynchronously
  • Understand that the documentation is a product
  • Have worked with and gained a solid understanding of Grafana and its ecosystem


Things you will almost certainly work on:

  • Understanding the user experience for services run by the consulted engineering team
  • Helping set target objectives for user experience specific to the team/service
  • Understanding the cost of running services
  • Setting target objectives for cost
  • Understanding relative service health to help guide engineering effort (SLOs)
  • Enhancing observability tooling to make the above possible
  • Enhancing alerting tooling to make the above actionable
  • Gaining deep understanding of service operation to guide disaster recovery and HA initiatives
  • Forming incident response best practices for the team
